headline.main: One Month Into the Afghan War

lead_paragraph: To the Editor: It is amazing that after only a few weeks there are complaints about the slow pace and length of the war (front page, Nov. 8). It is understandable that we want to go back to our day-to-day life, but we have had it most dramatically demonstrated that this was a state of denial. A desire to return to that state for our own immediate comfort is the terrorists' greatest weapon. They are an ever-present, patient, evil threat, and like other forms of crime can never be eliminated.
abstract: Jim Charlton letter comments on November 8 article on complaints about pace of US military campaign in Afghanistan against terrorism
